title: Papers: Liverpool want Argentine wonderkid Farias
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Thursday's national newspapers...

title: Galton wins WSL Player of the Month award for January
shortDescription: Manchester United forward Leah Galton has won the Women's Super League Player of the Month award for January.

title: Antonio questions Zouma reaction: 'Is what he's done worse than racism?'
shortDescription: West Ham's Michail Antonio has questioned the reaction to the Kurt Zouma cat-kicking incident, saying: "Is it worse than players convicted of racism?".

title: Keane no longer in running for Sunderland job
shortDescription: Roy Keane is no longer in the running for the vacant Sunderland manager's job, after the two parties could not come to an agreement.

title: Spurs on Y-word: 'It's time to move on'
shortDescription: Tottenham have released a statement on their fans' use of the Y-word, saying that "it is time to move on" from associating the term with the club.

title: Conte: Mental instability costing Spurs | Hasenhuttl: Our best performance
shortDescription: Antonio Conte says the mental instability within his Tottenham squad was to blame for their 3-2 defeat to Southampton.

title: Saka: Arsenal was always the club I wanted
shortDescription: Bukayo Saka has told Sky Sports Arsenal were always the club he wanted to join despite having a trial with fierce rivals Tottenham as a youngster.

title: Man City beat Bees to go 12 clear | Pep: We're not best in world
shortDescription: Manchester City moved 12 points clear of Liverpool in the Premier League title race with a 2-0 win over Brentford, who gifted City both of their goals.

title: West Ham fine Zouma after RSPCA take cats | Adidas drops defender
shortDescription: Kurt Zouma's cats have been taken away by the RSPCA after a disturbing video emerged of him hitting, dropping, and kicking his pet across his kitchen floor on Monday.

title: Eidevall: Pressure is privilege and belief key for Arsenal
shortDescription: "For me, it always starts with belief. It cannot start with success as the starting point. Belief creates success."

title: PL hits & misses: Is Coutinho back to his best? | Spurs' defence crumbles
shortDescription: There are signs of the old Philippe Coutinho after he continued his fine start to life at Aston Villa, while Antonio Conte watched Tottenham's defence crumble.

title: Zaha | From sublime goal to ridiculous penalty miss
shortDescription: Wilfried Zaha marked his return to Crystal Palace by scoring a sublime goal which was then followed by one of the penalty misses of the season in their 1-1 draw against Norwich City.

title: PL Predictions: Free-scoring Spurs to beat Saints
shortDescription: The Premier League is back with a full midweek fixture list and Jones Knows has you covered for insight, analysis, score predictions and best bets.

title: Should Celtic's winner have stood?
shortDescription: Celtic's Jota grabbed his second and the visitors' crucial third in their 3-2 win against Aberdeen but the home side felt it should have been ruled out for offside.

title: Gerrard tips Ramsey for England call
shortDescription: Steven Gerrard tipped Jacob Ramsey for England after his brace in Aston Villa’s thrilling draw with Leeds.

title: Premier League top-four race: Fourth place up for grabs?
shortDescription: We assess the runners and riders in the race for the top four, their form and their fixtures until the end of the season...

title: Premier League relegation picture: Who is going down?
shortDescription: The battle for Premier League survival continues - but which of the contenders are best placed to avoid the drop?

title: Ramsay secures point for Ross County
shortDescription: Kayne Ramsay was the late saviour for Ross County as his stoppage-time equaliser secured a 1-1 draw with Livingston.

title: Watt haunts Motherwell as Dundee Utd end winless run
shortDescription: Dundee United returned to winning ways in the Scottish Premiership with a comfortable 2-0 victory over Motherwell, with Tony Watt coming back to haunt his former club.

title: Villa and Leeds share six goals in frantic draw
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights of Aston Villa's draw against Leeds United in the Premier League.
